OOC: Okay, somewhat back to normal, still coughing a bit but I am in my rig=
ht of mind..

BIC:

Night Shift was holding quite a bit back from Scorponok=
.  If he had told him the absolute truth, that was it, the mission was a fa=
ilure.  Yet, there was still a way around his questions.  He knew just the =
trick.  He shows him his ability to switch signatures, this was indeed vali=
d. and in doing so, when his signature is switched to Autobot/maximal frequ=
ency, he is in tune with what happens on the other side of the fence.

" Ye=
ah, there is somethn' I should tell ya.  When I switch signatures ta keep t=
he Autobots unaware of my faction status, I'm in tune with everything that =
happens.  Includn' a change of status among the Autobots. I got a heck of a=
 vibe just now.  See this?  This little indication light, when I switched o=
ver, this came up.  That means one of them just got a slag of an upgrade.  =
And I know who too.  Tucson's a Prime now.  He got his mitts on the Matrix'=
s power and he got it.  Slag it, I was so close ta stoppn' 'em too."  

He =
hoped his fortelling would ease suspicions among the Predacons and Deceptic=
ons.  After all, confessing something as such was a big gamble for any bot.=

>

plann'n an all out assault on you guys, like tryn' ta take this place for t=
he Maximals and Autobots. Wants ta level the fortress ta the ground. What I=
 think we gotta do is beat 'em at his own game. And he knows we're gonna tr=
y'n get at the Ark, and if we go there, we're done for. See? It's not easy =
gettn' around the guy because he ain't your average scrap heap. He don't th=
ink like an average Autobot. So, if I were you guys, that shell program you=
 got gon' on, I think ya better have a bot make a backup of that'n hold ont=
o it. Because he's gonna try'n blow this place sky high, and everything wit=
h it. And as far as I know he'll be barrelln' in here with the rest of his =
posse any time now."
> >
> > Of course he was telling them a complete lie, =
hoping they'd buy it. His tone shows no indication of telling a fib. Inside=
 he was hoping that his idea mixed with Tucson's would take hold.
> 
> Scor=
ponok nodded thoughtfully and attentively as Nightshift talked,
> his optic=
 getting a speculative hue to them. "How does Tuscon expect
> to accomplish=
 his task?" the large Predacon asked, his voice betraying
> only a few misg=
ivings about Nightshift and his story. "The Maximals
> have to know that th=
is fortress can be made near impregnable should
> Hydras command it."
> 
> =
As Nightshift talked of the shell program Scorponok's musing attitude
> bec=
ame sharp as he looked back at the mech. "The shell program is well
> prote=
cted." He said, obviously his suspicions comming once again into
> focus. "=
And with all of us here, there is no way that he could take us
> all. He al=
ready arttempted to break in here once, and he failed. It
> would be foolis=
h for him to try again."
> 
> Scorponok's optics narrow as he watched Night=
shift, "Unless of course

m us . . . " Scorponok

Nightshift's

ld
